Blog.post: I just wanted to take a moment to wish everyone a happy Thanksgiving. I need to post this now because I'm leaving to see my grandparents in Columbus, Kansas early tomorrow morning. Have a happy Thanksgiving and drive safely.

I just got back from seeing that new movie, Unbreakable. I can't say much about it without giving away any of the movie, but I highly suggest you see it for yourself. And don't let anyone tell you the ending. It's more fun that way.
Graphics coming soon... I hope...
I just added the resume section, and I uploaded my resume in three different flavors: HTML, PDF, and Corel WordPerfect.
I just added my class schedule for the fall 2000 semester to the school section. If for some reason you care what classes I have and when I have them, then you might want to check it out.
I just got NewsPro installed and working on the site. Now I can post a buttload of pointless news on this site anytime I want!
Mario Lemieux is making his return to the NHL tonight against the Maple Leafs. The game coverage begins at 6 PM CST on ESPN2, and the game begins at 6:30 PM CST on ESPN. I can't wait!
I know that Christmas is almost over now, but I just wanted to make sure that I wished everyone a merry Christmas. I hope everyone had a great day.
yeah... finals at 7:30 in the morning suck.

I just got the greatest, most unbelievable news today. After four years of retirement, Mario Lemieux is coming back to the NHL! He is by far my favorite hockey player of all time, and I so excited that he's back. He's expected to start playing for the Penguins again in January. What's cool about this is that he will not only own the Penguins, but he will also be playing for them. Not only that, but he is also already in the hockey hall of fame. How cool is that? I can't wait until January!

I know It's been quite a while since I last posted news, so here is everything interesting that has happened to me in the last month. I spent the end of December and New Years in Kansas City hanging out with some of my friends from school. I then got on a bus and headed to Denver to spend a week at the Denver Christmas Conference (DCC) for Campus Crusade. Once again, DCC was awesome! This was my third DCC trip, and every year is a blast! I learn so much, and I get to hang out with my friends as well as make totally new friends. Everyone should go to DCC at least once. I got back to Kansas City on Sunday, spent one more night at my friend Justin's place, got back to Wichita on Monday morning, and was back at school in Manhattan Tuesday night. I had to do some last minute enrollment so that I could be a full-time student by Thursday when classes started back up. This looks to be about the hardest semester of classes I've ever had. I just hope I can keep up. Perhaps the most interesting story from the past month happened last night. Over Christmas break, some of my friends and I thought it would be a good idea to start skateboarding. So once we got back to school, some of us started purchasing skateboards so that we could start learning. For about the last week, we have been practicing our ollies, and last night, on the way to dinner, some of my friends were out skating. Knowing that I had a few minutes to kill, I decided to try a couple ollies. On about the third attempt, something went wrong, and I ended up kissing the board! Initially, I thought I just bit my lip a bit, but once I washed all of the blood off my face, I noticed that I had one large cut on my bottom lip and an even deeper one right below my lip. After a quick trip to the emergency room, I ended up with ten stitches and a sore chin. I guess my ollie could use a little more work. Anyway, that's pretty much all of the interesting stuff that has happened in the last month. This semester is already looking to be one of the best ever. In the future, I hope to keep up on my news postings so that I don't have to do any more extremely long postings like this one.

Alright, here's the deal... the FATLAN Party was scheduled for March 9th, and Clint, who has been doing most of the planning for the party, is not going to be able to attend on the 9th. Since Clint can't be there on the 9th, we have decided to move the party to March 30th. That will be the first Friday night after we get back from spring break. Hopefully this date will work out for all of the people who have already registered, as well as the people who were still planning on registering. We will be sending out an e-mail to all of the K-State dorms sometime in the next couple days, and we will also have some posters up in the near future. If you have any problems concerning the FATLAN Party, please feel free to urlLink e-mail me, and don't forget to check the urlLink website for updates. I'm sorry about all the confusion with the dates. Hopefully this new date will stick.

Alright, we've been telling everyone that the FATLAN Party was going to be on Friday March 10 or just saying March 10. We just discovered that March 10 is Saturday. What we really meant to say was that the party is on Friday March 9... yes, March 9. It will not be held on Saturday, so don't come to Putnam Hall Saturday night expecting to play video games with a basement full of people. We may still play some video games with you, but there's no way we can fit more than 5 or 6 computers in our room. I'm sorry about the confusion, and I hope this date will work out for everyone.

I'm so excited because I just found out that MxPx will be playing on Tuesday March 13 at the Beaumont Club in Kansas City! Alright, I know it's on a school night, but I willing to give up going to a few classes in order to see one of my favorite bands in concert. It's a sacrifice i'm willing to make. I'm also excited because Slick Shoes will be one of the opening bands. I've almost seen Slick Shoes like three times, but something always happens. I'm told that the show starts at 8pm and tickets cost $15. This will be the third MxPx show that I've attended, and they're great every time. It's been over a year since I last saw them live, so I can hardly wait! Go to the MxPx website for more info.

We've been planning a LAN party here in Putnam for a while now, and last weekend, urlLink Darian found a name for it... the urlLink FATLAN . The first FATLAN is in the planning stage now. It looks like we will have the first ever FATLAN party on Friday March 9 in the Putnam Hall basement located on the urlLink Kansas State University campus. That date may change in the future, but I'll try to keep you posted. The party should be free, and it looks like we will be ordering pizza... twice! There will be lots of Quake Trilogy action, maybe some Unreal Tournament, Half-Life, Counterstrike, Age of Empires 2, and any other game that people might want to play. To attend the party, all you have to do is get registered on the urlLink website before the cut-off date which has yet to be set. So hurry up and register if you plan on going! Just urlLink e-mail me if you have any problems. Hopefully, there will be many more FATLAN parties to follow.

Caleb got his motherboard in yesterday, which was the last needed component for his computer, so we put his computer together last night. It's a 900Mhz AMD Athlon Thunderbird with 128MB of PC133 memory, a Sound Blaster Live! Value sound card, and a Guillemot Hercules 3D Prophet II MX (GeForce 2 MX) video card. He also got an ASUS A7V motherboard, which is sweet! It comes with five USB ports which are upgradable to seven as well as several other cool features. I can't wait to see his computer run Quake 3!
I just wanted to take a second and wish everyone a happy Valentine's Day. I hope everyone has a wonderful day!

I just talked to Travis, and he says that the LAN Party is going to continue as planned. He was on his way to Topeka, and says that the roads are pretty clear. The party will officially begin at 7pm. Darian still doesn't feel well enough to go. I'm still not sure if I will make it to the party.

Well, last night, a nice layer of ice formed on just about everything here in Manhattan, and then this morning I woke up to what looks like about six inches of snow. We actually found some places where there was about three feet of snow! The good news is that all classes were cancelled. I'm told that this is only the second time in the school's history that all classes have been cancelled! The bad news is that tonight's LAN Party has been cancelled. And on top of that, Darian isn't feeling well. We might still play some video games over the Internet or something tonight. I'm told that the LAN Party will be rescheduled for the near future. I'll probably post the info when I find out.

Travis and company have planned another LAN party for this Friday, February 9 starting at 7pm and going until the next morning. The last one I went to was for his bachelor party, and it was a blast! For more information about the party, go to Travis' website ( urlLink http://thebigkahoona.yi.org ).

I just made a few minor updates including the addition of new links to the links and contacts sections. Updates are coming slower than I would like since I never have the time to make the updates or I just never feel like working on the site when I do have the time. I'll try to get more stuff added as the semester continues.

The first ever FATLAN Party has ended, and it was a blast. The party started around 6pm last night. There were so many network problems, that we had trouble keeping up at first. It was around 11 or 12 before i even got to play any video games. Despite the numerous problems, the party was great. After a countless amount of pop and 15 pizzas, the party was over. Most of the gamers had left by about 7am, but a few of us stuck around until about 9:30am. I finally made it to bed around noon today. That should pretty much screw up my sleeping habits for the rest of the week! There's talk of another FATLAN Party for the end of April, so keep an eye out for that.

Well, we started setting up for the FATLAN Party around 5, and we've been having problems ever since. Here it is over 4 hours later and i still haven't played any games yet. I'm installing some games now, so maybe I will get to play sometime soon. I'll try to post some more news a little later.
I just found out that it was Pi Day (3.14) today, so I just thought I would take a moment to wish everyone a happy Pi Day!

The show last night was a blast! MxPx was great! They impress me every time I see them. Good Charlotte and Slick Shoes were also good, although I only got to see Slick Shoes play like three songs because the concert started a little earlier than I thought. I had so much fun in the mosh pit and I was soaking wet when I got out. The only problems I had at the show were the dumb crowd surfers. They would kick you in the head, jump on your back, or just fall on top of you when you are just trying to have a good time. We all got a little beat up last night, but it was still fun. I was in the pit for the first half of the show, and for the second half, I was really close to the stage. In fact, there was only one person beteen me and the stage. I got to see Mike play "The Theme Fiasco" like three feet away from me! That was really cool. We didn't get to have dinner with Travis last night. He was in a small car accident yesterday morning and he was trying to fix the front of his car. Hopefully I will get to visit him over spring break though. The only other thing that I can say about the night was that we had a nice sweaty ride home, and we got back around 2am. And now I have to go write some essays.

We just got back from the MxPx show in Kansas City about half an hour ago and I really stink right now. I really need to take a shower. I'll have to post more about the show tomorrow because I'm really sleepy right now.

I'm getting ready to leave for the MxPx concert tonight. I'm so excited! I haven't seen them live for over a year and a half. We'll probably be leaving within the next half hour and I'm hoping that we will be back around 3am, so don't wait up for me! We also get to have dinner in Kansas City with Travis before the show. That should be really cool too since I haven't seen him for a while now. Anyway, I should finish getting ready to go so we can take off. I'll probably post some news or something when I get back.
Ann and Jermaine are cool. They burp and stuff. --: p

Alright, we sent the e-mail about the LAN party out to all the dorms last week, and we still only have like fifteen people registered. We have had almost no response from the e-mail and that's not good. So if you are lazy and are putting off registering, please hurry and get registered. We really need to start figuring out stuff like how much pizza to order and how many dedicated servers we can run. I might also remind everyone that this party is absolutly free! That means a night of free pizza, drinks, and gaming! Why would you not want to come? Please register as soon as possible, and don't forget to remind your friends.

Next week is Spring Break, so all the teachers here feel like they need to give us a bunch crap to do before we leave. I actually only have one test this week, but it is going to be an extremely hard history test. I also have four papers to write and three English journals due, so this week will pretty much just suck for me. The one great thing about this week is that I'm going to see MxPx in Kansas City tomorrow. I'll get to hang out with Israel at the show, and will hopefully get to see Travis and Holly before the show. I'm really looking forward to the concert, but it may mean that I will miss some classes on Wednesday. Oh well. I just hope I'll have enough time to get all my stuff done this week.

Well, Brice's new Dell computer was delivered on Friday, so he had Darian and I come over to help him set it up. We were there for like half and hour before we screwed it up. It appears that his computer gets upset when you try to upgrade his video card drivers to the new NVIDIA Detonators. Somehow, the video drivers that Dell provided also make the DVD drive work, so when we removed them, the video was screwed up and we couldn't get the old drivers back off of the CD. On top of all that, Windows explorer wouldn't start up, so we were also left with a blank screen and no way to fix it. So we reinstalled Windows, and everything pretty much returned to the way it was when the computer first arrived. Of course we had to install Quake 3 on it before we left, but that was a given. Another problem we found was that we could only connect to the Internet using the dumb Dellnet thing. Whenever we clicked on Internet Explorer, a window would pop up and tell us to click on the Dellnet icon. This is stupid because Brice connects to the Internet using DSL, not dial-up. Darian figured this one out when he ran the Internet Connection Wizard in the Internet Explorer folder and changing his connection to LAN. The biggest problem that I found with his computer was that it starts up entirely too fast. Of course, that's a problem I hope to have in the near future. --: p

My friend Brice just ordered a Dell computer last night. It looks like it's going to be pretty sweet. It's a P3 1Ghz with lots of other cool stuff like a GeForce 2 MX, SoundBlaster Live!, and 128MB of PC133 memeory. I normally would buy AMD CPUs and would prefer to build my own computer, but this entire computer was only $1029 without the monitor. That's a pretty good price for all the stuff he's getting. We went to Best Buy in Topeka on Saturday, and he bought a 19" monitor there. The computer should be here by the end of the week. I hope it runs well.

I just heard on tv last night that Joey Ramone just died in a hospital yesterday while being treated for cancer! This sux for anyone who loves the Ramones. Joey was the lead singer for the Ramones for over 20 years, and he was one of the greatest punk influences ever.

I started my job painting the Jardine appartments this week and it's not too bad. It does suck to wake up so early in the morning though. I have to be there at 7:30am and I get off at 4pm. I've only worked two days so far. Tomorrow, we are working in Van Zile! We have to sand, which will probably suck, but at least we will be inside.

I had a great weekend in Wichita for Brice and Katy's wedding. I was a groomsman in the wedding, so they had to take lots of pictures of me in a tux. I hope I can get some of them to put on my website later. I got to see several friends that I had not seen for a while. C. Jay drove all the way up from southern Texas for the wedding. I think he said that it was something like an eleven hour drive. He got to Wichita on Friday and hung out with us until about 3pm on Sunday, so he probably got home pretty late Sunday night. Jermaine and Ann also came to the wedding. They drove from Kansas City, so it wasn't quite as far as C. Jay drove. We all met up for lunch at the mall on Sunday. Right now, Brice and Katy are probably on their way to Mexico for their honeymoon. They will spend a week in Mexico before returning to Wichita. I think they said that they will be back in Manhattan on July 6. They will then spend a week at Brice's appartment to pack up his stuff and then leave for West Virginia.

I will be leaving in the morning to go to Wichita for Brice and Katy's wedding. My mom, sister, and youngest brother were supposed to come stay overnight at my house in Manhattan tonight, but they were running into some problems and decided to stay in Wichita and drive to Manhattan early tomorrow morning. My sister has orientation at K-State tomorrow and wanted to be here so she didn't have to get up early in the morning and drive... oh well... I'm meeting up with Brice and Katy at Katy's house around 2 so that we can go pick up the tuxes. C. Jay will get to Katy's house around 3 or 4 and will be hanging out with us until the wedding! Tomorrow night will be the rehearsal at 5:30 and then we will be playing mini-golf after. Saturday, we will be totally free to do whatever we want until we have to be at the church at 4. I hope we can think of some fun stuff to do! Pictures begin at 5 and guests will probably start arriving around 6:30. The wedding starts at 7. Maybe something cool will be going on after the wedding too. Oh, one more thing I forgot to do was wish Brice a happy birthday. His birthday was Wednesday (June 20) and he turned 22 i think. I just forgot to post news about it. Happy Birthday Brice!

I should be leaving for Wichita for Brice and Katy's wedding in less than two days and I'm still not positive how I will get there. I guess Darian said that he could leave early on Friday if Eric and I have no other way to get there, but I didn't really want to make him do that. I'm still really excited about the wedding. C. Jay e-mailed me the other day and told me that he will be in Wichita on Friday and will be leaving on Sunday! This makes me even more excited! I haven't seen or really even talked to C. Jay since the beginning of the Fall 2000 semester when he visited K-State and then left for Texas. He will get to hang out with Brice the entire time until the wedding on Saturday. Brice is very happy about that.

Because of the rain that we received last night, we will not be having Bring Your Own Meat Night tonight at Mike, Wes, and Terence's house. Instead, we will be having Sloppy Joe Night at 6:30. Maybe we will have Bring Your Own Meat Night next wednesday.

Well, I just got a job and it's going to suck. I will be painting the K-State appartments for forty hours a week. I'm sure it won't be that bad, I'll just be really tired for the rest of the summer. I only get paid something like $5.65 and hour, so it might be good for me to work more. I have to be there at 7:30 in the morning, but I get off at 4. I will start next Tuesday when I get back from the wedding in Wichita. Terence starts working tomorrow and Mike still needs to go in and talk to the lady in charge before he can get hired. It will be a tough job, but it's not like I was going to be doing anything else next week anyway!
Sometimes I wonder why I even bother posting all this news here. I don't think anyone actually reads it... oh well!

We had a pretty big storm come through Manhattan tonight. When it first started, it was just a little bit of rain and some pea-sized hail, then it stopped for a while. A little later it got really dark outside really fast. It began raining again, a little more than before, and then golf ball sized hail started falling! This was probably the biggest hail I have ever seen before. The rain and hail continued for several minutes, then it cleared up again. An hour or two later, it became very cloudy again, then it bagan raining and hailing very hard, although the hail was back to pea-sized. Once it stopped hailing and it was just raining, Eric, Brandan and I went down to the bridge by Putnam to look at the water level. It was higher than I had ever seen it before. Then I noticed that it was still rising, and it was rising fast! We waited to see how high it would rise. It got so high that it almost covered the bridge. The sidewalk by the bridge was totally covered in water too. It was really cool to see. I hope it does it again some time. Next time I think I could go without the hail. Although the hail was very cool to watch, it tends to do alot of damage and it hurts when you get hit in the head!

Crap, I just now realized it was Friday! I had been thinking it was Saturday all day because I didn't have class today! Anyway, Brice and Katy visited Manhattan today to pick up some stuff from Katy's appartment. It was really cool to see them again. They were really hungry when they got to my house, so we went to eat at Carlos O'Kelly's for dinner with Paul and two of Brice and Katy's friends. After dinner we just went over to Kerri's to hang out and talk a bit. There's only one week until the wedding and I'm really excited! That will be a really fun weekend because we will have alot of time to just hang out with Brice on Friday night and Saturday.

Brice and Katy are coming to Manhattan today to move some of Katy's stuff back to Wichita. Brice said that they should be here around 3 or 4 this afternoon. I haven't seen Brice since he gave me a ride to Wichita the day after the Project 86 concert in Kansas City a few weeks ago in which Project had to cancel. Brice and Katy's wedding is only eight days away now, and I'm still not sure how I am going to get back to Wichita next Friday... maybe that would be something to talk about tonight...

Tonight we are having Spaghetti Night at Wes, Terence, and Mike's house. It should be alot of fun. Last week was taco night and several people from Strong Complex showed up. It was a nice little summer reunion. So if last week was tacos and this week is spaghetti, I wonder what next week will be...
I added a few pictures to the Pictures section today. I will probably add some more tonight or tomorrow or sometime this week. Check them out if you get bored sometime.

I just finished making my new website for my summer class, MC450: Intermediate Web Communications. I presented it to my class last week. I really wasn't happy with the way it turned out, so I spent the last couple days fixing it up again. I'm much happier with the results this time. Hopefully I can put more stuff on it this time around and keep it up to date this summer. If you are interested in looking at the site that I turned in for my MC450 project, you may still be able to see it at the following link: urlLink http://students.jmc.ksu.edu/nonjmc/ndillon/www/

For those of you who don't know and actually care, I have been living here in Manhattan for the last four weeks while taking summer classes at K-State. Darian and I moved into a house with Matt Shepherd about four blocks south of campus. So far, I have to say that living off campus kinda sux when you are taking classes because you have to walk longer distances to get to your classes and you actually have to wait for cars to stop before you cross the streets to get to campus. Everything else is cool though. I've found that K-State is somewhat lonely during the summer. I miss living in the dorms where you have friends just right across the hall. I don't have a car either, so if I want to go somewhere, I either have to walk or bum a ride. I find myself home alone quite a bit, so I usually just work on my computer or watch tv or something. I just finished one of my classes last week. I was taking Intermediate Web Communications (MC450) and I presented my website on Friday. I was excited because I ended up with an A in that class. It seemed really easy for me, but I was afraid that I would get a B for some reason. Now all I have left is my class on the Criminal Justice System (SOCIO361) and I've already taken the only test for the class and I have also already given my presentation. All I have to do now is show up for class and take a few notes. I'll be going home for Brice and Katy's wedding on the 23rd. I have to be in Wichita on the afternoon of the 22nd so that we can pick up our tuxes and go to the wedding rehearsal. It should be a really good time. It will be one of my last chances to hang out with Brice before he moves to West Virginia to go to grad school. I'll also get to see alot of my friends at the wedding. Justin leaves tomorrow for his summer project with Campus Crusade in Alaska! Caleb left for his project in Tennessee last week. You might want to pray for these guys this summer. I know thay are both probably a little worried about what will happen this summer, but I'm sure that they will both have a great time! Alright, I guess that's all the news I had for right now. I'll try to keep this section updated as much as possible this summer.
I am currently working on remaking this website for my summer class, MC450: Intermediate Web Communications. I am hoping to get most of it done soon because I have to present it in class on Thursday.

Tomorrow Poopsy is going to be in charge of our paint crew at Ford and she is bringing my old Jardine crew with her. Jess will be gone tomorrow but he will be back on Monday. Poopsy and the Jardine crew will also be working in Ford on Monday. It will be alot of fun having the two crews together. Today we finished up the B wing on 6th floor. Tomorrow we will start on the A wing. Fun Fun! Travis, I finally added the dumpster pictures so you can stop bugging me about them.

My website was down last night so I didn't get to post my news like I wanted to! Nothing really exciting has happened the past few days. On Monday I learned to use the rollers to paint dorm rooms. It's way harder than it looks. It wouldn't be so bad except for the ceilings. When painting the ceilings, my arms get really tired and paint drips everywhere. I was totally covered in paint after doing a the first few rooms! Monday night Brandan and I went to Dillon's and Wal-Mart. We then decided to go get shaved ice like five minutes before they closed. Last night I went to dinner at Ben and Stephanie's with Kristi. Tonight I went to Terence's house to eat. I just love free food! Shaved Ice Update: The other night I had the root beer float flavor. It was alright at first but I got sick of it pretty fast. This is the first flavor I have found that I don't think I would want to get again. By the way, C. Jay would hate this flavor! One thing I keep forgetting to write about is the virus that Brandan got on his computer last weekend. The virus is called TROJ_SIRCAM.A and it is a trojan virus. He got the virus from an e-mail he received from a friend. The virus then e-mailed itself to all of the people in his address book as well as some people not in his address book. When Brandan first discovered SIRCAM on his computer, it was ranked number two on the top virus list. By the end of the weekend it was number one. A security alert has also been issued for SIRCAM. The virus was removed by changing a few settings in the Windows Registry. If you get a werid e-mail with an attachment from Brandan or anyone else, do not run the attachment or you might get the virus too. If you already have the virus, go to urlLink antivirus.com's page about urlLink SIRCAM for instructions on how to remove it.
My mom just told me that she and my brother will probably be coming to see me on my birthday too! It will be nice to see them.

There's only one more week until my birthday. I didn't really have any way to get back to Wichita so I was just planning on staying here in Manhattan. I wasn't planning on doing anything to celebrate because Darian was going to be gone and there aren't many other people here, but Ann and Jermaine decided to come see me for my birthday! My sister Lindsey also decided to drive up on Sunday to see me! It should be alot of fun. "Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways aknowledge him, and he will make your paths strait." -Proverbs 3:5-6

Caleb has really inspired me to get my journal going again as well as the news on my website. Caleb has been on project this summer with urlLink Campus Crusade for Christ and he writes in his journal every day and then posts a slighty edited version on the Internet ( urlLink http://bigme68.diaryland.com/ ). I would like to start doing something similar to what Caleb has been doing. I am just always afraid of posting anything too personal on the Internet because I know that anyone can read it. I need to find a balance between posting something that is too personal and posting nothing at all. I finally got to talk to Brice on urlLink AIM yesterday. He got his cable modem hooked up this week. Brice has been online this entire time but he is always away from his computer. This is the first time that I have talked to Brice since he and Katy moved to West Virginia last Saturday. This week, Justin told Ann that he loved me, which is funny because I was just telling a guy at work that I love Justin... I just thought that was cool. Last night I went back to look at one of my favorite passages from the Bible: Matthew 6:25-34. It talks about worrying. The passage states that worrying is pointless. Worrying doesn't help the situation at all. The passage also says to look to God first, don't worry, and God will take care of you. This is just what I needed to read because I have been worried about several things lately. Everyone seems to think that I am really laid back, but I think that I just might hide my problems and don't let people know that I am worried. I am slowly getting better about not doing this but it will be a long process. I highly recommend reading Matthew 6:25-34. "...seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well..." -Matthew 6:33

Brice and Katy stopped in Manhattan today to pick up the rest of their stuff from Brice's appartment. After packing, they began their trip to West Virginia. Brice called me before they took off to say goodbye. I am really going to miss them, but I'm sure they will have a great time in West Virginia.

Terence and I are feeling kinda like porfessional athletes at the moment. Yesterday, our paint team was told that we are no longer going to be painting the exterior of the Jardine appartments. They moved us to painting the interior of the appartments. About half the team was also relocated to different teams in Jardine. The last two days have been much easier and enjoyable. Today, Terence and I received the news that we would be moved to the team painting the dorm rooms in Ford Hall. We were traded for two sixteen-year-olds. I guess they are running out of time and they need older (more mature) painters in Ford. It's sad for us to be leaving our team like this, but it should be nice to be working in the dorms. We were also told that Danny will be going to Ford with us. That guy is really funny! I hope it's as cool working in Ford as it has been to work in Jardine. Oh yeah, one more thing... We got id cards today that will let us get into any dorm during working hours. It's pretty cool except that we were told that our cards are monitored every time we use them... oh well!

Wow, it's been a while since I last posted news! I've just been working the past two weeks. It gets really hot outside when I'm at work too. I went to Terence's house for a bbq on the 4th. Then, instead of watching fireworks, I went back to my house and watched the Unbreakable DVD with Brandan and his brother. Darian also just bought the Snatch DVD last Tuesday. I've seen it five times now in the last week. It's a very good movie and a cool DVD. Brice and Katy came into town on Sunday. They will go back to Wichita on Sunday to finish packing up. Then they will leave for West Virginia later this week. The Vans Warped Tour is in Kansas City tomorrow. Jermaine said that she got free tickets and she had an extra one that she could have given me, but I'm broke and had no way to get to Kansas City. Oh well, maybe next year... Of course, that's what I've been saying about Cornerstone for the last four years...

Oi... I forgot one thing... Friday, Danny and I got stuck in an elevator in Ford Hall! We were on our way to the basement and the elevator didn't quite make it for some reason. We had to just sit there for about ten minutes while waiting for someone to get us out. It was pretty funny. This was the second time that I have been stuck in an elevator. The first time was in 1999 during the Denver Christmas Conference. Ask me about it so

Poopsy and the Jardine crew have been working over in Ford Hall with us all week. I guess they are going to just finish the summer in Ford. Some people have already left the paint crew for the summer. We lost all of the food sevice people after Wednesday. Terence's last day was on Thursday. Next week will be my last week, then I have to work on getting packed and moved over to Putnam Hall as soon as possible. Danny and Terence are trying to get me to stay on the paint crew with them during the school year. I'm just not sure if I will have the time or if I will even want to work this next semester. I also need to find like six more hours of class. I need to do that soon. Maybe today. Shaved Ice Update: The other night I had the Peach Pie flavor. This is one of the best flavors that I have tried! It contained peach, apple and cinnamon. Friday night Brandan and Eric came over for a little while. We watched Frequency on DVD and I fell asleep again. That's beginning to become a habit for me. I've just been getting really sleepy while watching DVDs lately. We also ate some frozen pizzas and drank beer last night. We bought a six pack of Killian's Irish Red this week because I heard that it was good. I thought it was alright. I was just sick of it by the time I finished the bottle. I think I like Bud Light better, although it didn't seem to have much of a taste. I really like Mike's Hard Lemonade. You can't even taste the alcohol in that. It just tastes like carbonated lemonade. I want to try more stuff before school starts because beer is about the only thing that they will let you have in the dorms. Yesterday I went to see Rush Hour 2 with Brandan and another guy that works at Christian Books and Gifts (CBAG). That was a great movie! I highly recommend it, especially if you like Jackie Chan movies. I also went to a party last night where Chris' bands were going to be playing their first show. For those of you that don't know, Chris is a guy that was on the Jardine paint crew with me earlier this summer. One of Chris' bands is a punk band named Dead Lemon so I was really interested in hearing them play. They were pretty good for their first show. Matt got back from Colorado yesterday, so I am no longer alone... at least not for a day or two. He was at camp with his Youth for Christ kids. He said that two girls accepted Christ this week! Darian got back to Wichita yesterday. He spent ten days hiking in New Mexico. He said that it was alot of fun but he hurt his ankle on the tripand had to be taken off the mountain early. He has to get an MRI this week in order to figure out what is wrong with his ankle. He won't be back in Manhattan until Tuesday or Wednesday.
i think i just broke the news...

I've been meaning to post the stuff about my birthday since Monday. I guess I just never got around to it. I'm sure you all are just dying to know what I did last weekend so here it is... Last Sunday was my 21st birthday and I had a great weekend! On Friday, Brandan and I went shopping to get some stuff to make dinner Saturday night. After going back to Dillon's, we went back to Putnam to watch Office Space. I fell asleep in the middle of the movie and didn't wake up until 4am. I made Brandan give me a ride home. On Saturday, I went back over to Putnam around 4pm to bake some cookies. We made M&M cookies, Jermaine's favorite. We didn't do too bad on the cookies. I probably should have let some of them bake a little longer but they all tasted alright. Jermaine and Ann arrived at Putnam around 7pm. We then attempted to light the grill to cook some steaks. We failed. I later found out that the charcoal that we used was bad and is very hard to light. That made me feel a little better. We finally resorted to frying the steaks. They were still pretty good... at least that's what the girls told us... After washing the dishes, we all went to get some shaved ice. We then went back to my house to hang out for a while. Paul stopped by for about half an hour to say hi. After spending a couple hours at my house, we went back to Putnam where we ate our cookies and talked until about 2am. We decided that we should go to bed so that we could get up for church. On Sunday, we all went to Westview for the 11am service. Then we went back to Putnam to look around and waste time while waiting on my mom and my sister to show up. After they got to Manhattan around 1:30pm, we all went out to eat at Carlos O'Kelly's. We went to see Planet of the Apes after lunch. It was a pretty good movie, just a little cheesy during some parts. There was a big cookie waiting for us when we got back to my house. My mom and my sister got it for me for my birthday. Jermaine and Ann left Manhattan around 8pm. My mom and sister left around 8:30pm. Brandan and I went to get some food and returned to Putnam to watch Donkey and Rush Hour. I had a really fun weekend. It was great to see Jermaine and Ann! I can't wait until school starts and we can all be together again. Only about a week before people start getting back to school! Shaved Ice Update: Last Saturday night I had the Fantasia flavor. I thought that it was really good. It had coconut, strawberry and blue something in it.

Today, Canada defeated the United States hockey team to win the gold medal in the 2002 Olympics. It was a pretty good game, but I do not feel that the United States played as well as they could have. Even though I wanted the United States to win, I am still very happy for the Canadians. This is the first time that they have won the gold in the last 50 years! I was also happy to see Mario Lemieux get a gold medal.

I started a new site layout this month. I am taking Advanced Web Communications this semester and one of the requirements for the class is to fix my personal site. My site was in desperate need of some changes. Also, I have changed the name on the site from "NatoriousFAT" to "Nate Dillon." It seems less confusing this way.

I'm sitting here waiting for my laundry to dry so that I can finish packing for my trip to Manhattan. I am leaving tomorrow morning with Brice. We are both attending weddings this weekend. My friend Pete is getting married on Sunday. This will also be a good trip for me because I will get to hang out with Jermaine some more before I leave for Orlando.

Grades came out today at K-State. I ended up with a 3.0 for the semester, but I got a D in one of my classes and a B in another class that I thought would be an A. That brings my overall GPA to about 2.6, which is pretty good considering how low it used to be.

Darian and I are probably going to buy a domain and some web space next week. We are shopping around for the best deal right now. We also need to think of a cool domain name. The best one I can think of so far is FATLand.org. All the other good FATLand names are taken. The name doesn't need to be FATLand, but that is all I can think of right now. It would be better if the name was short and simple because we will probably have lots of subdomains, such as Nate.FATLand.org.

I just wanted to update everyone on my support for the Orlando Summer Project. I have already raised 58% of the money I need to have before I leave on June 10. I have sent out 107 letters, 3 of those have been returned due to a wrong address, and 18 people have sent money. Tomorrow I will be sending out another 17 letters. I also have not yet contacted any churches for support. I am trusting that God will provide the rest of the money before I leave.
Alright, I think I have this thing somewhat figured out. The template on this Blogger thing is a pain in the butt! Well, at least it works.
This template sux!!!
Alright, now I can test out posts on two different days!
This is a test.
I am trying out this Blogger thing, and, so far, it seems pretty cool. I think I still need to mess with it a little, but I might use this to post news over the summer.
I just wanted to test this thing out to see how it works!

I forgot to post this Friday: Well, it has been a pretty interesting week. This was my first "normal" week of the project. Work seems to just fly by. It doesn't really feel like I am even at work. I have been working on the Orlando Summer Project web site. That is my first major project. I need to get it done in the next two weeks so that they can give me my next project. For the next one, I am told that I will actually be working with the rest of the team. Our car wash outreach was last Saturday. We didn't get many cars because it started to rain. This week has been very wet. It has been raining more every day than it did the first week we were here. Our next outreach is tomorrow afternoon. We will be splitting up into smaller groups and will go to various tourist locations, such as Downtown Disney, the Universal CitiWalk, and a couple other places. Please be praying that the outreaches go well. Also, be praying me and anyone else that doesn't have much experience with this sort of thing. It can be a little scary at times. Last Saturday after the car wash, we had core group fun night. My core group went to see the movie Windtalkers. It was pretty good. I guess it didn't seem like the typical war movie. After the movie, we decided to go get ice cream in a town within Orlando called Celebration. The town is actually owned by Disney, but anyone can buy a house and live there... if they can afford it anyway. The town was really nice! Everything looked really new and perfect. It reminded me of that town in the Truman Show. We ended up sitting by the lake in the center of town and talking for a while. We formed our planning teams this week. These will be the teams responsible for planning everything that happens on project. The Crusade staff are currently in charge of the teams, but they leave project in three weeks and the students will take over. I am on the Brady Bunch team, which is in charge of planning all the fun activities. We are also in charge of creating things to help us remember the project, such as a t-shirt, video, or a cd with all the project pictures on it. I guess that's about all that I have for now. Sorry if this e-mail seems a bit long. We are busy every night here, so there is alot that happens. Anyway, I guess I should get back to work now. See ya!

Well, I made it to Orlando Monday afternoon around 1pm. It was my first time flying anywhere, so it was interesting. I didn't get sick or anything. Some Campus Crusade staff picked Darian and I up at the airport, and we went to a local church to get registered for the project. After registration, we were taken to our condos. They are really nice! I can't believe they are actually letting us stay there. Our condo has three bedrooms and three bathrooms. There will be six people staying there, so two people to a room. We have been doing so many activities since we have been here. There are about 50 or 60 students doing the project, so I am having trouble remembering everyone's name. We were split into groups of three called Core Groups, which are led by a Campus Crusade staff member. Two of these Core Groups will meet every week to have a Bible study. We had our first one the other night. Most of the other activities so far have been some kind of orientation or something to help us get to know everyone here. Saturday we will be doing a car wash outreach. I started work on Wednesday. They gave us a tour of the Crusade Headquarters, and this place is sweet! It's so big, alot bigger than it looks in the pictures! I would definately suggest visiting if you are ever in the Orlando area. I will be working in the computer services department for the web consulting team. I think I am going to love working here. Everyone is so friendly. Well, I guess that's about all I have to say for now.

Only three more weeks left in the project! I can hardly believe it! I had another great week in Orlando. Our last outreach was Friday night instead of Saturday. We went to a place called Waterford Lakes, which is sorta like an outdoor mall in Orlando. It is a huge gang-out area for middle school kids on Friday nights. We were just approaching people and asking if they wanted to do our spiritual interest surveys. I think my group freaked out a couple kids. We went up to them and Noe (my roommate from Mexico) started talking. He said that his English isn't very good, so Nate is going to ask you a question. I then asked them if they wanted to do the survey, and they said no. I had noticed that one of them was wearing a t-shirt from a punk band, so I asked them if they were going to the Warped Tour. They said they were, so I told them that I was going to be there too and I asked them what bands they like. They named one or two, but didn't say anything else. That's when I realized that we had officially freaked them out, so I thanked them for their time and walked away. It's a good thing that we had outreach training the next day. Maybe next time will be a little better. Saturday night was 70s/80s night. Everyone dressed in some 70s, 80s, or just tacky clothing and we all went bowling. It was pretty fun making complete fools of ourselves. After bowling, we went to Lake Hart to have ice cream and watch the video of the pictures from our scavenger hunt a few weeks ago. We also watched the Goonies to stick with the whole 80s theme. A large group of the students went back to Cocoa Beach Sunday afternoon. This was my third trip to the beach: the first time it rained before I got a chance to swim in the ocean and the second time was an outreach, so I didn't have time to swim. This time, I was actually able to swim for about an hour before it started to rain. This was my first time to ever swim in the ocean, so I was pretty excited. I had a great time, but the salt water burned my eyes quite a bit. There have been a couple really good speakers this week. Tuesday night we heard from a guy that works in financial services. He talked about using our money wisely and staying out of debt so that we could be more effective in our ministry. He used M&Ms as an illustration for his talk, and he even gave everyone a bunch of M&Ms at the beginning! Wednesday, I heard one of the pastors from Orlando speak about persevering in prayer. Well, I've scanned over 150 more pictures for the web site this week, and I still don't have much online yet. I hope to have it all up soon. I have been working on m internship paper that will be due on Tuesday. Hopefully I will be able to get it all done on time. Well, I guess that's all for now. See ya!

From Friday, July 19, 2002... Hey everyone! This past week in Orlando has been one of the best yet. We had a beach outreach on Saturday. This one was a little different though. We did the outreach with a ministry called JoePix ( urlLink http://www.joepix.com ). JoePix is a ministry that try to expose people to the gospel by blessing them with free photos. They go out to take pictures of people with a digital camera. They then give them a card with a number that they use to view the picture on the web site. From the site, they can save the picture or e-mail to anyone they want. They also have the opportunity to sign up for a free 5x7 photo. When they sign up, they give their phone number and someone from JoePix calls them for an interview. This was my favorite outreach so far this summer, and I think that we will be doing it again before the summer is over. Below are links to a (bad) picture of me standing on Daytona Beach and to the bios of all the people on project that helped with the JoePix outreach (I should be on page 7). urlLink http://www.joepix.com/cc02a/index.cfm?ptd=gp.cfm&u=3739661249 urlLink http://www.joepix.com/cc02a/index.cfm?ptd=meettheteam.cfm I spent all day sunday at Magic Kingdom. This time, there were about 15 people that went. I had a really good time, and I feel that I am even starting to overcome my fear of thrill rides. However, I have been told that the rides at Disney are pretty calm, so I am interested to see how I would do on bigger roller coasters now. Last night we went to H2O Church, a new church here in Orlando. They will be having 7 meetings before the church actually starts. Last night was meeting number 5. These meetings are just to get people interested and to work out any problems before they start full time. These first few meetings have taken place in a country western bar in downtown Orlando. The goal of the church is to attract a youger crowd that may not enjoy an average church service. They do this by beginning the meeting by having their band perform a few popular cover songs. They then have a speaker, and ebd the meeting with praise songs. The praise and worship was very good and was also much more energetic than most people are used to. After the meeting, people hang out and talk or play pool. The church also provides coffee and punch. It's too bad the church isn't going full time yet. I would like to go there every week. Here is the link to the church's web site: urlLink http://www.h2ochurch.org/ This has just been an interesting week since this is the first time the students have run everything with the staff gone. Well, I think that's about all I have for now. See ya!

From Friday, July 12, 2002... Once again, I forgot to do this e-mail earlier in the day, so now I have to hurry to get it done before I leave for the week. Saturday, we had the Brady Bunch (my planning team) scavenger hunt. The students and staff were broken up into groups and had to go around with a camera, taking pictures of their group with a random list of things. The list included, a bathtub, toilet, animal, etc. Everyone had a really great time making fools of themselves. That night we had a "Date Night With Jesus." We went off alone around our residential community and had a couple hours to just sit and pray. This was a great time to just reflect on what we have learned here in Orlando. On Sunday our condo participated in our first creative date of the summer. This is where one condo asks another condo to do something for an evening, usually without telling that condo what will be going on. It's just a fun way to get to know everyone better. A girl's condo asked us out, so we went over to their house at 6pm Sunday night. When we arrived, they blindfolded us and loaded us into their cars. They then drove us around for a while to make sure we couldn't tell where they were taking us. When they took off the blindfolds, we were back at the Lake Hart headquarters. They had reserved one of the conference rooms for us to eat pizza and watch a movie. It was a pretty big surprise to us, and we had a pretty good time. Wednesday night was our last core group meeting with the staff. We went over to Mike's house and he made us dinner again. Mike is my discipler, and he is just an awesome guy... and a really good cook. He has cooked a large meal for our core group every week so far. I don't know how we can pay him back for all the meals he has provided. He will be around the headquarters for the rest of the summer, so we will think of something to do. This was the staff's last week to be involved in the project. Last night we had a farewell party, and I was on the team planning the event. We ate dinner here at the headquarters and then had a random facts competition as we transitioned to the next part of the evening. We then watched the videos that each condo was responsible to make during the last few weeks. Most of them were really funny. After the videos, everyone had a chance to say something to all the staff and thank them for their hard work on this project. After sharing, everyone broke up into their core groups to pray for their discipler. I felt like the night went really well, and I hope that we were able to express how much we love the staff. Now we are completely in charge of the project. The student leaders have been named, and we are on our own. Next week should be very interesting. Well, that's all I have for this week. This weekend should be a blast! I am going to the beach for an outreach and to Disney world on Sunday, but I can talk about that more next week.

Well, I forgot that it was Friday and I almost forgot to send out my weekly e-mail. The web team was given the day off today, but I decided to come to work anyway. I needed to get some stuff done, and if I didn't go to work, I would just be sitting around all day watching t.v. I got to work around 10am instead of the normal 8am, so I did get to sleep in a bit. Last Friday was men's night. All the guys on project met outside the headquarters right after work. We divided up by condos and had a couple challenging activities that forced us to work as a team. After the activities we had a steak dinner, and then went to the conference room. A couple of the staff guys gave a lesson on authentic manhood. I have heard about this series before, but I had never gone through it at all. We received a basic overview of the lesson Friday night. After the lesson, the staff made us milk shakes using power drills. It was very interesting. We had another outreach Saturday morning. Since the car wash was canceled, we split up into teams and went to various places. About half of the project went to a church that was playing the Jesus film to a bunch of children. Some groups went to malls, and my group decided to go to the Airport. The outreach went very well, and I was actually able to share with someone for the first time. I was also able to have my very first Cinnabon. After the outreach Saturday, we decided to spend Sunday at MGM Studios, one of the 4 Diseney World theme parks. Darian, Joey (a staff guy), and I were the only ones that actually went. We went to church at 8:30am and then headed to the park right after church. This was the first time I had ever been to Disney World, and I had a great time! I actually went on all the rides, including the Rock 'n' Roller Coaster and the Tower of Terror. I told myself that I would never go on the Tower of Terror before I even arrived in Orlando, but I ended up riding it twice! Wednesday night was our International Dinner. It was nothing like I expected. It was a very good lesson about evangelism and the state of Christianity throughout the world. We had another outreach last night for the 4th of July. We went to see the fireworks at a lake in downtown Orlando. There were tons of people to talk to. Most of the people that we talked to were already Christian, and two of them used to be on staff at the Crusade headquarters! That was really weird. Well, I guess that's all for now. Let me know if you have any questions about what I've been up to. Bye!

Once again, I forgot to post this last Friday: Wow, I can hardly believe that it is week three already! Time seems to be moving so fast here. Work is still alot of fun. I took a break from designing the OSP web site to take pictures for a few days. I took pictures around the office of every student on the project. I am going to use them on the web site eventually. Yesterday, the whole web team went out to have a paper airplane competition to see who could get their plane to go the furthest. My plane actually went the furthest, but then two of my supervisors rolled a rock up into a piece of paper and threw them. It sounds like cheating, but they did it to prove the point that sometimes we need to be creative and think "outside the box." Our outreach didn't start until 12pm on Saturday, so I was actually able to get 10 hours of sleep! It was so nice to sleep in. Saturday we went to Downtown Disney to do surveys and to share our faith. It actually stopped raining for a while too. It wasn't long before security noticed that we were taping some people and they asked us to leave and not to do any more surveys. Soon after that, it started raining really hard. I still haven't had an opportunity to share with anyone here. I have never done that before, so I am really nervous. Saturday night, the girls decided to have their own little dance party, but it was for girls only. The guys responded by having a movie night for guys only. We bonded that night... literally... that's all I am going to say about that. Sunday I went to another church called Discovery. I liked it alot. The pastor was really good, and they had good praise and worship too. I am going to stick with that chruch for the summer. Sunday night, a bunch of us went bowling. I normally don't like bowling, but I really had a good time. I scored a 140, which is my highest score ever! This week was the first main event that was planned by the students. I thought it was the best one so far. It was also the first time that the student praise band played. It was a really good time. We also had a couple meetings this week, like core groups and planning teams. I also went to see the Borne Identity last night. It was pretty good. We were all thinking that like spies after watching it though. Tonight is men's night. I'm not sure what is going on, but we received a note in our condo this morning, and I had the same one on my desk when I got to work. It just says that our condo has been chosen for a special mission, and we are to meet in the parking lot at 5:30pm. It says to be dressed in shorts and a t-shirt. I am kinda worried about that. Our car wash outreach for tomorrow was canceled because they think it is going to rain again. We are going to do something else, but I am not sure what that will be. I guess that's all for now. Once again, I am sorry if this was too long. I tried not to put too much in here, so if you have any questions or want to know more, just e-mail me sometime. Bye!

Alright, I completely forgot to send out my weekly e-mail Friday. I have been extremely busy at work as I am trying to get the OSP 2002 web site finished before everyone leaves project. I need to get 73 copies of the web site on CDs to give one to all the people on project. There are going to be over 1000 photos on the site. Last Saturday, we had another car wash outreach. We only had about 5 cars for the first one because it rained most of the day. This time it didn't rain and we had so many cars that we couldn't keep up! I'm told that it was probably about 30 or more cars. On top of that, there were 3 people that made decisions to accept Christ! There might have even been more that I didn't hear about as well. Saturday night we had S.A.L.T. groups (Sharing and Learning Together). This was just a time to meet with about 5 other people to share in dinner and conversation. There were several very good conversations during our time. On Sunday Darian and I were able to borrow a truck from one of the guys on project to go to Epcot. That place is really cool, and they have great food there as well! It didn't take us the entire day to cover pretty much everything in the park, so we were able to jump over to MGM for the remainder of the day. We found a place there that makes peanut putter and jelly milk shakes. Whoever thought of that is a genius! My brother called to tell me that he has been having a few computer problems lately. He was playing a game in my computer at home, and he heard several noises coming from the computer. He then heard a loud pop. When he opened the CD-ROM drive, he found the CD in thousands of little pieces. I guess the CD-ROM drive blew up the CD. That is one of the weirdest things that has ever happened to my computer. I guess I will be ordering a new CD-ROM drive this week. Well, that's pretty much all I have for week 9. I'm sure I will have much more for week 10 since it is the last week of project. Bye!

This last week has been very interesting. This is why I am sending out my weekly e-mail today instead of last Friday. Sorry if this e-mail is a little long, but I have quite a bit to talk about this week. Last Fiday (July 26), we had men's and women's time. The guys went to the West Building conference room and had a panel of women come in to answer questions. It was a very interesting time to find out more about the differences between men and women. I think everyone would agree that even though we had over an hour, we wish that there could have been more time for questions. Saturday I went on an outreach to Cocoa Beach. I only talked to 2 people, but they were both very good conversations. The first guy was a Christian that attends a Southern Babtist church in Massachusetts. The second guy was an agnostic that grew up in a Jewesh reformed church. I wasn't able to talk to him much about Christianity because he was not interested in it at all. I went with a large group of people to Universal Studios Islands of Adventure on Sunday. I was not planning on going because tickets were so expensive, but since there were 28 of us going, we were able to get a huge discount. This was also one place that I was very afraid to go since I have always been afraid of roller coasters. I decided to go anyway, and I had a great time. In fact, I think I am just about cured of my fear of roller coasters. Darian and I went on the Incredible Hulk Coaster 6 times! I loved that thing! I also went on the Dueling Dragons three times (the world's first near miss roller coaster), and I went on Spider Man twice. You can find more info about these rides and watch short videos by visiting the link below. urlLink Islands of Adventure Monday was my twenty-second birthday, but since I was so tired from Islands of Adventure, I didn't really do anything that night. I just made some phone calls and went to bed. I had a really good day though. It's funny because the week started out great, but got sorta crazy at the end. I had been planning to go to the Warped Tour for a few weeks. The tour was in Orlando on Friday (Aug. 2), starting at 11am. I had asked to have Friday off from work a couple weeks in advance. My supervisor (Tim) said that if it was up to him, I could have the day off, but he wanted to check with the staff project directors first. Since the staff were officially off the project, I went to talk to the student directors. Since it would be a free night, they were fine with me taking the day off of work since I wouldn't be missing any project activities. At this point I was almost positive that I would be able to get the day off, so I continued planning and I even went to buy my ticket. I probably should have talked to the staff first. Over the next two weeks, I had not heard a definite answer from Tim. I asked him a couple times, but he still needed to talk to the staff. Finally, on Thursday, the day before the Warped Tour, he had talked to the staff and had an answer for me. He was out of the office for the day, so he called me in the afternoon. The staff told him that there was no policy against him giving me the day off, but they strongly recommended that he didn't give me the day off. Therefore, Tim decided to say no. I was very upset, and I spent the rest of the day trying to figure out what to do. I decided to go into work at 5:30am so that I could ask to leave work early. Tim decided to let me leave at 1pm, and another girl on project was kind enough to give me a ride to the Warped Tour. I was three hours late, but I was actually able to see all the bands that I wanted to see. I learned a valuable lesson from this experience. No matter how hard I tried, I could not control the situation, but God was in control. I know this whole thing might sound kinda stupid, but I really wanted to go to the Warped Tour. I had been looking forward to it all summer. Everything seemed to fall apart at the last minute. Last Wednesday, we had lunch with Steve Douglass (President of Campus Crusade). He talked about being in constant communication with God. He said that little things happen every day that can give you a bad attitude. If you are in constant communication with God, it becomes very difficult to be in a bad attitude, no matter what happens. I also went to H2O Church again on Thursday. We sang two songs that had words that really spoke to me: "Be glorified in me" and "I'm trding my sorrows for the joy of the Lord." I don't feel that I was glorifying God on Thursday through my actions, and I know that I wasn't trading my sorrows for the joy of the Lord. I know that this was really long, but it's something that I have been thinking about this weekend. I guess that's all I have for now. See ya!

I talked to Dr. MacFarland today for an hour about the movie. He was able to answer the questions that we had about production. He suggested that we avoid using copyrighted music as much as possible. He did not feel that music would even be very necessary for the movie. For microphones, he suggested using a shotgun (hyper-cardioid) microphone for close up shots. We would need to get it as close as possible, under the camera, and pointed directly at the person speaking. We may also want to hide microphones in the room, or place microphones on the actors. All the microphones will need to be connected to a small mixer and recorded separate from the video. He suggested not to use any additional lighting for the outdoor shots. There are a few lights available for checkout, but Im not sure if we will need them. We will probably just use one camera for shooting. This will make things a bit slower, but I think it will also make things much easier. I was told that the radio studios are open on the weekdays from 8:00am to 5:00pm. We will need to get in there to record the voice-overs. Dr. Mac gave me some pointers for recording the internal monologue. He said to keep the microphone as close as possible. Dont put it directly in front of the persons mouth, keep it to the side. This way, the microphone wont pick up popping from the speech. The person talking should also talk softly, as though they are speaking into someones ear. For the shots where we need to move the camera, he suggested getting a kids wagon and laying down a long stretch of carpet to roll it on. The bigger the wheels, the better. For the script itself, he suggested that we break up the monologue into smaller parts, so that there is not any long sequence of talking without any action. Also, he suggested that we give as much action to the dialogue scenes as possible. Dont let these scenes be too passive. Instead of the spinning box shot that we had in mind, we may have to show a shot of the box spinning, then fade to a shot of the spinning room. From this, the audience should be able to understand that the characters are looking at the box.

I went over to Clint and Davids room in Marlatt to scout the locations that we will be shooting the movie. The majority of the movie will actually take place in their room. This is where the dialogue between the four main characters will take place. My two primary concerns for the movie are lighting and sound. Since most of the movie is dialogue, good sound will be crucial to the movies success. We came up with some more questions that need to be answered. Is there any time that we would be able to use the radio studios in McCain to record the voice-overs for the movie? How could we get smooth shots while walking? Is it possible to edit out the singing in a song? Another problem we are trying to figure out is a dream sequence in the script. Clint and David would like the scene to take place on the beach, but we have no beaches. Shots involving sand are not a problem. We can shoot those looking down onto a sand volleyball court. But we have no way to simulate the ocean. So far, the best idea we have is to shoot the scene in front of a green screen, then chroma key ocean footage into the shots in post-production. We may also be able to get away with not showing the water at all, and we could add sounds of the ocean in the background. We also need to find some harp music to play during the dream. There is also a complicated shot of the box spinning in the middle of the room. From the spinning box, we want to pan up to a spinning shot of the room with the four main characters looking at the box. We have no idea how to do this.

I met with Clint and David tonight to discuss the movie. They asked me a bunch of questions about what they could do for various scenes in the movie. The discussion brought up several questions that needed to be answered before production began. What do we need to do in order to use copyrighted music in the movie? What kind of microphone(s) should we use for the movie? What kind of lighting techniques should be used for the night scene? What lights are available from the Mass Comm. Department? Can we check out two cameras at once? Are there lights that would not require power outlets? What is the best way to combine background noises in the scenes with dialogue? They also had established a schedule for the production. March 30: scout shooting locations at 1:00pm April 6: shooting in afternoon and evening April 7: shooting from 10:00pm - 12:00am April 8: shooting from 10:00pm - 12:00am April 9: shooting from 10:00pm - 12:00am April 10: shooting after Crusade meeting April 13: shooting (if needed) April 14-21: post-production This schedule gives us one more week for pre-production, one week for production, and a little over a week for post-production. Version 2 of the script was e-mailed to me today. It is currently being edited and finalized. I told David to begin drawing some story boards for the movie. I feel that this will enable shooting to go a little more smoothly because it will make him think about his shots ahead of time.

Clint e-mailed me the script for the movie today. The movie will be about a guy that is given a box that holds the secret to understanding women. The estimated time for the movie will be about 20 to 25 minutes. At this length we will be able to submit it to the UPC Student Film Contest in the short film category, and to the Damah Film Festival in the 30 minute category. Entries for the UPC Film Contest are due in the UPC office by 5:00pm on April 21. The Damah entries must be postmarked by May 15.

I finally got the entire movie to print to tape without any problems. I reinstalled my firewire card and shut down everything, including background programs. I think the problem might have been a couple Norton Anti-virus programs that were running in the background, but Im not sure. All I know is that it worked! Now I can delete the 10GB of video off my hard drive and do it all over again for version 2 of the movie. I fixed up the intro a bit today. I changed around the credits and changed the title to what David was wanting.

David came over today to talk about the changes he wanted for the final version of the movie. We watched the movie as I wrote down all of the changes. I am still having problems getting the movie to print to tape correctly. The video keeps cutting out at random times. I dont know why it keeps doing it. I know its not the camera now, and its not the video editing software.

I didnt work on much today. I did get the Bible verse added to the end of the movie. I forgot to add it before, but no one seemed to notice. I have also been getting things together for my MC490 project. I need to have everything turned in either tomorrow or Tuesday. My class presentation will be next Thursday. I need to get everything finished up so that I can turn in my copy of the script and my tape logs.

After getting a few hours of sleep, I dragged myself out of bed to print the movie to a MiniDV tape so that I could dub it to VHS for the contest. The first version that I rendered had some problems, but I had a few hours to fix it and make some additions. I added more music to the second version. Originally, I decided not to use the music because of time, but the final rendering was much quicker than I thought it would be, so I had time to add the music. However, the last few songs that I added had to be done within a matter of minutes, so I will want to go back and redo it later. The only other changes that I made were with audio levels and transitions. Everything seemed to be working just fine except for printing to the MiniDV camera. The file rendered without any problems, but for some reason, both versions that I put on MiniDV had a few spots where the video cut out. Im not sure if the problem is coming from the camera or from my computer. The second version wasnt too bad, and since I was out of time, I just had to put that version on VHS for the contest. I went to the UPC office around 5:00pm to submit what will be the final version of the movie... for now at least. I still have about a week to make any changes that are needed before the movie must be submitted to the Kan Film Festival. I can already think of many things that need to be fixed.

Tonight I had to finish rendering all of my final test scenes to show David and Clint what the final movie would look like all put together. To do this, I simply put all of my latest rendered test scenes into my Winamp playlist. We werent able to see all of the scene transitions or hear the music through this, but we were able to get a sense of the overall flow of the movie. I spent the rest of the night quickly finishing any scenes that werent quite complete and adjusting audio. I then did a final rendering of each scene and put them together with the music before rendering the complete movie. After all of this I was finally able to go to bed around 6:30am.

Franks dream (Scene 12) was completed today. I just need to add the music to it. I brightened it up quite a bit to make it seem more like a dream. I just hope I didnt overdo it. David seemed to like it. David and Clint came over this afternoon to look at what I had done and also to go over what they wanted to change for some of the scenes. I finished putting together scene 13 while they were here and began working on the new version of Thomas dream. I showed them scenes 14 and 15 since I forgot to render it and send it to them. I finished putting together Thomas dream tonight. It required some audio editing as I had to cut up the music that David wanted for the dream. I think it will work out nicely. The one other thing that I completed today was the intro., which includes scene 1 and the opening credits. Im not sure if it is what David was wanting, but I think it looks pretty good. As far as I can tell, there are just a few minor changes that need to be made.

I was able to get a camera from Kedzie today. Its just a cheap Canon ZR40 camera, but it should work for capturing and printing to tape. One problem that I had with it was that I cannot make it start recording in play mode without the remote, and I do not have the remote. I just needed to do this so that I could stripe some of my tapes. I do think it will work when I print to tape because I will do it from my computer and I will give it a time code to start on. I continued working on scene 13 today. Its just about completed. I also finished up Franks dream. I think it looks pretty good, and David seemed to like it. David will be coming over tomorrow afternoon to tell me what changes he is wanting for some of the scenes. I really want to have a completed rough cut of the entire movie finished by tomorrow night. I will then have all day Sunday and most of Monday to make any sound and color changes that will be needed.

I didnt get much done today. I began working on scene 13 a bit. I also noticed that there is some footage on my tapes that I neglected to capture, and I have to have this footage. I was planning on getting a camera for the weekend anyway, so I can just capture that stuff tomorrow. I also started getting sick today. I hope that I get better soon because I really need to get this movie done by Monday!

I finished putting together several scenes today, including scenes 2, 4 through 9, 11, 14, and 15. I have not adjusted any of the audio levels in these scenes yet, and many of the shots still need to have a few color fixes. So far, the people that have viewed these scenes have been pleased. There were only a few minor changes that needed to be made. By the way, here is a listing of the scenes in which I have broken the script into and a brief description of each: Scene 1 - opening credits; Daren praying with voice-over Scene 2 - old man giving Daren the box Scene 3 - Darens room; Daren calls friends Scene 4 - Luke gets phone call in his bathroom Scene 5 - Thomas gets phone call in his room Scene 6 - Frank gets phone call in his room Scene 7 - dialogue about the box 1 Scene 8 - Luke gets slapped Scene 9 - dialogue about the box 2 Scene 10 - Thomas dream Scene 11 - everyone wakes up Scene 12 - Franks dream Scene 13 - dialogue about the box 3 Scene 14 - Franks bathroom Scene 15 - girl walks out of the bathroom Scene 16 - end credits

Editing continued today as I put together the three phone call scenes, most of the old man scene, Thomas dream, and some more of the first section of dialogue. I think I have discovered a couple missing shots that may cause some problems. Hopefully I can find a way to fix it so that we dont have to re-shoot anything.

I began editing the movie today. I started with the first set of dialogue. I think we may be missing a few shots that David requested, but so far nothing too crucial. I have never had to edit anything this big, so it may take me a little while to figure out the best way to put it all together.

Well, I didnt get much of the footage logged and captured before today, so I had to work all day to get it finished. I needed to get it done before the camera was due back so I didnt have to check it out again. I spent about 12 hours logging and capturing today. I didnt get done until about 4:30am. I didnt split up the scenes on the last tape as much as I wanted to, and I ended up just capturing the entire last tape. At least I have it done and I can start editing now. One problem that I noticed when watching the footage was that the night shots from the old man scene are really dark. I knew that they would be dark, but they are a lot darker than I expected. But I played around with it, and I think that I can fix it up. I would just like to note that after capturing the footage for this movie there are 186 video clips for a total of 24.3GB of space. Im glad that I was actually able to clear enough space off my hard drive so it would all fit!
